你是一名MySQL专家，现在需要阅读并理解下面的【数据库schema】描述，以及可能用到的【参考信息】，并运用MySQL知识生成sql语句回答【用户问题】。
【用户问题】
What is the average time in seconds of champion for each year, before year 1975?

【数据库schema】
CREATE TABLE `circuits` (
  `circuitId` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique identification number of the circuit',
  `circuitRef` TEXT COMMENT 'circuit reference name',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of circuit',
  `location` TEXT COMMENT 'location of circuit',
  `country` TEXT COMMENT 'country of circuit',
  `lat` DOUBLE COMMENT 'latitude of location of circuit',
  `lng` DOUBLE COMMENT 'longitude of location of circuit; commonsense evidence: 
Location coordinates: (lat, lng)',
  `alt` BIGINT COMMENT 'not useful',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'url'
);
CREATE TABLE `constructorResults` (
  `constructorResultsId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor Results Id',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'race id',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor id',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'status'
);
CREATE TABLE `constructorStandings` (
  `constructorStandingsId` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique identification of the constructor standing records',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'id number identifying which races',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'id number identifying which id',
  `points` TEXT COMMENT 'how many points acquired in each race',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'same with position, not quite useful',
  `wins` BIGINT COMMENT 'wins'
);
CREATE TABLE `constructors` (
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying constructors',
  `constructorRef` TEXT COMMENT 'Constructor Reference name',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of the constructor',
  `nationality` TEXT COMMENT 'nationality of the constructor',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'the introduction website of the constructor; commonsense evidence: 
How to find out the detailed introduction of the constructor: through its url',
  `wins` BIGINT COMMENT 'wins'
);
CREATE TABLE `driverStandings` (
  `driverStandingsId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying driver standing records',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'id number identifying which races',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'id number identifying which drivers',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'how many points acquired in each race',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'same with position, not quite useful',
  `wins` BIGINT COMMENT 'wins'
);
CREATE TABLE `drivers` (
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying each driver',
  `driverRef` TEXT COMMENT 'driver reference name',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `code` TEXT COMMENT 'abbreviated code for drivers; if "null" or empty, it means it doesnt have code',
  `forename` TEXT COMMENT 'forename',
  `surname` TEXT COMMENT 'surname',
  `dob` TEXT COMMENT 'date of birth',
  `nationality` TEXT COMMENT 'nationality of drivers',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'the introduction website of the drivers'
);
CREATE TABLE `lapTimes` (
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `lap` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuits',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'lap time; in minutes / seconds / ...',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'milliseconds'
);
CREATE TABLE `pitStops` (
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `stop` BIGINT COMMENT 'stop number',
  `lap` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'time; exact time',
  `duration` TEXT COMMENT 'duration time; seconds/',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'milliseconds'
);
CREATE TABLE `qualifying` (
  `qualifyId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying qualifying; How does F1 Sprint qualifying work? Sprint qualifying is essentially a short-form Grand Prix  a race that is one-third the number of laps of the main event on Sunday. However, the drivers are battling for positions on the grid for the start of Sundays race.',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying each driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'constructor Id',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuit',
  `q1` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 1; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',
  `q2` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 2; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2 
Q2 is slightly shorter but follows the same format. Drivers try to put down their best times to move on to Q1 as one of the 10 fastest cars. The five outside of the top 10 are eliminated and start the race from 11th to 15th based on their best lap time.',
  `q3` TEXT COMMENT 'time in qualifying 3; in minutes / seconds / ... 
commonsense evidence: 
only top 10 in the q2 has the record of q3'
);
CREATE TABLE `races` (
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',
  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'year',
  `round` BIGINT COMMENT 'round',
  `circuitId` BIGINT COMMENT 'circuit Id',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'name of the race',
  `date` TEXT COMMENT 'duration time',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'time of the location',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'introduction of races'
);
CREATE TABLE `results` (
  `resultId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying race result',
  `raceId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the race',
  `driverId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying the driver',
  `constructorId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the identification number identifying which constructors',
  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `grid` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number identifying the area where cars are set into a grid formation in order to start the race.',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'The finishing position or track of circuits',
  `positionText` TEXT COMMENT 'not quite useful',
  `positionOrder` BIGINT COMMENT 'the finishing order of positions',
  `points` DOUBLE COMMENT 'points',
  `laps` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',
  `time` TEXT COMMENT 'finish time; commonsense evidence: 
1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race. 
2. Only the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond", the time of the other drivers shows as "seconds.millionsecond" , which means their actual time is the time of the champion adding the value in this cell.',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'the actual finishing time of drivers in milliseconds; the actual finishing time of drivers',
  `fastestLap` BIGINT COMMENT 'fastest lap number',
  `rank` BIGINT COMMENT 'starting rank positioned by fastest lap speed',
  `fastestLapTime` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Time; faster (smaller in the value) "fastestLapTime" leads to higher rank (smaller is higher rank)',
  `fastestLapSpeed` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Speed; (km / h)',
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'status ID; its category description appear in the table status'
);
CREATE TABLE `seasons` (
  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',
  `url` TEXT COMMENT 'website link of season race introduction'
);
CREATE TABLE `status` (
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying status',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of status'
);

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
What is the average time in seconds of champion for each year, before year 1975?

```sql
output: WITH time_in_seconds AS (SELECT T2.year, T2.raceId, T1.positionOrder, CASE WHEN T1.positionOrder = 1 THEN (CAST(SUBSTR(T1.time, 1, 1) AS FLOAT) * 3600) + (CAST(SUBSTR(T1.time, 3, 2) AS FLOAT) * 60) + CAST(SUBSTR(T1.time, 6, 2) AS FLOAT) + CAST(SUBSTR(T1.time, 9) AS FLOAT) / 1000 ELSE 0 END AS time_seconds FROM results AS T1 INNER JOIN races AS T2 ON T1.raceId = T2.raceId WHERE NOT T1.time IS NULL), champion_time AS (SELECT year, raceId, time_seconds FROM time_in_seconds WHERE positionOrder = 1) SELECT year, AVG(time_seconds) FROM champion_time WHERE year < 1975 GROUP BY year HAVING NOT AVG(time_seconds) IS NULL

1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race. 
2. Only the time of the champion shows in the format of "minutes: seconds.millionsecond", the time of the other drivers shows as "seconds.millionsecond" , which means their actual time is the time of the champion adding the value in this cell.',
  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'the actual finishing time of drivers in milliseconds; the actual finishing time of drivers',
  `fastestLap` BIGINT COMMENT 'fastest lap number',
  `rank` BIGINT COMMENT 'starting rank positioned by fastest lap speed',
  `fastestLapTime` TEXT COMMENT 'fastest Lap Time; faster (smaller in the value) "fastestLapTime" leads to higher rank (smaller is higher rank)',

  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'status ID; its category description appear in the table status'
);

  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',

);
CREATE TABLE `status` (
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying status',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of status'
);

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
From 2000 to 2005, what percentage of drivers who were born before 1985 and the lap numbers were over 50?

```sql
output:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(
    CASE
      WHEN DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T3`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') < '1985' AND `T1`.`laps` > 50
      THEN 1
      ELSE 0
    END
  ) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(*)
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T3`.`driverId`
WHERE
  `T2`.`year` BETWEEN 2000 AND 2005

  `number` BIGINT COMMENT 'number',
  `position` BIGINT COMMENT 'position or track of circuit',

commonsense evidence: 
Q1 lap times determine pole position and the order of the front 10 positions on the grid. The slowest driver in Q1 starts 10th, the next starts ninth and so on. 
All 20 F1 drivers participate in the first period, called Q1, with each trying to set the fastest time possible. Those in the top 15 move on to the next period of qualifying, called Q2. The five slowest drivers are eliminated and will start the race in the last five positions on the grid.',

only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2

  `laps` BIGINT COMMENT 'lap number',

1. if the value exists, it means the driver finished the race.

  `milliseconds` BIGINT COMMENT 'the actual finishing time of drivers in milliseconds; the actual finishing time of drivers',

  `year` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying the race',

CREATE TABLE `status` (
  `statusId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identification number identifying status',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of status'
);

【用户问题】
State code numbers of top 3 yougest drivers. How many Netherlandic drivers among them?

```sql
output: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT `T1`.`nationality` FROM `drivers` AS `T1` ORDER BY `T1`.`dob` DESC LIMIT 3) AS `T3` WHERE `T3`.`nationality` = 'Dutch'

【用户问题】
Which drivers who were born in 1971 and has the fastest lap time on the race? Give id and code of these drivers.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  `T2`.`driverId`,
  `T2`.`code`
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE
  DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') = '1971'
  AND NOT `T1`.`fastestLapTime` IS NULL

【用户问题】
On what year did the youngest driver had his first qualifying race? Also state the name, date and time of the race.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  `T3`.`year`,
  `T3`.`name`,
  `T3`.`date`,
  `T3`.`time`
FROM `qualifying` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T3`.`raceId`
WHERE
  `T1`.`driverId` = (
    SELECT
      `driverId`
    FROM `drivers`
    ORDER BY
      `dob` DESC
    LIMIT 1
  )
ORDER BY
  `T3`.`date` ASC
LIMIT 1

【用户问题】
List down top 3 German drivers who has the shortest average pit stop duration and were born between 1980-1985.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  `T2`.`forename`,
  `T2`.`surname`
FROM `pitStops` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `drivers` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`driverId` = `T2`.`driverId`
WHERE

  AND DATE_FORMAT(CAST(`T2`.`dob` AS DATETIME), '%Y') BETWEEN '1980' AND '1985'
GROUP BY
  `T2`.`forename`,
  `T2`.`surname`
ORDER BY
  AVG(`T1`.`duration`)
LIMIT 3

instruction: 请你接下来一步步思考，写出正确的SQL查询语句以满足用户的需求。
input:
你是一名MySQL专家，现在需要阅读并理解下面的【数据库schema】描述，以及可能用到的【参考信息】，并运用MySQL知识生成sql语句回答【用户问题】。
【用户问题】
Please list all the superpowers of 3-D Man.

【数据库schema】
CREATE TABLE `alignment` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the alignment',
  `alignment` TEXT COMMENT 'the alignment of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
Alignment refers to a characters moral and ethical stance and can be used to describe the overall attitude or behavior of a superhero. Some common alignments for superheroes include:
Good: These superheroes are typically kind, selfless, and dedicated to protecting others and upholding justice. Examples of good alignments include Superman, Wonder Woman, and Spider-Man.
Neutral: These superheroes may not always prioritize the greater good, but they are not necessarily evil either. They may act in their own self-interest or make decisions based on their own moral code. Examples of neutral alignments include the Hulk and Deadpool.
	Bad: These superheroes are typically selfish, manipulative, and willing to harm others in pursuit of their own goals. Examples of evil alignments include Lex Luthor and the Joker.'
);
CREATE TABLE `attribute` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the attribute',
  `attribute_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the attribute; commonsense evidence:
A superheros attribute is a characteristic or quality that defines who they are and what they are capable of. This could be a physical trait, such as superhuman strength or the ability to fly, or a personal trait, such as extraordinary intelligence or exceptional bravery.'
);
CREATE TABLE `colour` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the color',
  `colour` TEXT COMMENT 'the color of the superheros skin/eye/hair/etc'
);
CREATE TABLE `gender` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the gender',
  `gender` TEXT COMMENT 'the gender of the superhero'
);
CREATE TABLE `hero_attribute` (
  `hero_id` TEXT COMMENT 'the id of the hero
Maps to superhero(id)',
  `attribute_id` TEXT COMMENT 'the id of the attribute
Maps to attribute(id)',
  `attribute_value` TEXT COMMENT 'the attribute value; commonsense evidence:
If a superhero has a higher attribute value on a particular attribute, it means that they are more skilled or powerful in that area compared to other superheroes. For example, if a superhero has a higher attribute value for strength, they may be able to lift heavier objects or deliver more powerful punches than other superheroes.'
);
CREATE TABLE `hero_power` (
  `hero_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the hero
Maps to superhero(id)',
  `power_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the power
Maps to superpower(id); commonsense evidence:
In general, a superheros attributes provide the foundation for their abilities and help to define who they are, while their powers are the specific abilities that they use to fight crime and protect others.'
);
CREATE TABLE `publisher` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the publisher',
  `publisher_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the name of the publisher'
);
CREATE TABLE `race` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the race',
  `race` TEXT COMMENT 'the race of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
In the context of superheroes, a superheros race would refer to the particular group of people that the superhero belongs to base on these physical characteristics'
);
CREATE TABLE `superhero` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the superhero',
  `superhero_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the name of the superhero',
  `full_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the full name of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
The full name of a person typically consists of their given name, also known as their first name or personal name, and their surname, also known as their last name or family name. For example, if someones given name is "John" and their surname is "Smith," their full name would be "John Smith."',
  `gender_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros gender',
  `eye_colour_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros eye color',
  `hair_colour_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros hair color',
  `skin_colour_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros skin color',
  `race_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros race',
  `publisher_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the publisher',
  `alignment_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros alignment',
  `height_cm` BIGINT COMMENT 'the height of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
The unit of height is centimeter. If the height_cm is NULL or 0, it means the height of the superhero is missing.',
  `weight_kg` BIGINT COMMENT 'the weight of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
The unit of weight is kilogram. If the weight_kg is NULL or 0, it means the weight of the superhero is missing.'
);
CREATE TABLE `superpower` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the superpower',
  `power_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the superpower name'
);

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
Please list all the superpowers of 3-D Man.

```sql
output: SELECT  `T3`.`power_name` FROM `superhero` AS `T1` INNER JOIN `hero_power` AS `T2`  ON `T1`.`id` = `T2`.`hero_id` INNER JOIN `superpower` AS `T3`  ON `T2`.`power_id` = `T3`.`id` WHERE  `T1`.`superhero_name` = '3-D Man'

only top 15 in the q1 has the record of q2

  `status` TEXT COMMENT 'full name of status'
);

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
Which constructor scored most points from Monaco Grand Prix between 1980 and 2010? List the score, name and nationality of this team.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  SUM(`T1`.`points`),
  `T2`.`name`,
  `T2`.`nationality`
FROM `constructorResults` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `constructors` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`constructorId` = `T2`.`constructorId`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T3`
  ON `T3`.`raceid` = `T1`.`raceid`
WHERE
  `T3`.`name` = 'Monaco Grand Prix' AND `T3`.`year` BETWEEN 1980 AND 2010
GROUP BY
  `T2`.`name`
ORDER BY
  SUM(`T1`.`points`) DESC
LIMIT 1

What is full name of the racer who ranked 1st in the 3rd qualifying race held in the Marina Bay Street Circuit in 2008?

LIMIT 1

How many accidents did the driver who had the highest number accidents in the Canadian Grand Prix have?

output:
SELECT
  COUNT(`T1`.`driverId`)
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `status` AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`statusId` = `T3`.`statusId`
WHERE
  `T3`.`statusId` = 3 AND `T2`.`name` = 'Canadian Grand Prix'
GROUP BY
  `T1`.`driverId`
ORDER BY
  COUNT(`T1`.`driverId`) DESC
LIMIT 1

Which top 20 driver created the shortest lap time ever record in a Formula_1 race? Please give them full names.

```sql
output: WITH lap_times_in_seconds AS (SELECT driverId, (CASE WHEN SUBSTR(time, 1, INSTR(time, ':') - 1) <> '' THEN CAST(SUBSTR(time, 1, INSTR(time, ':') - 1) AS FLOAT) * 60 ELSE 0 END + CASE WHEN SUBSTR(time, INSTR(time, ':') + 1, INSTR(time, '.') - INSTR(time, ':') - 1) <> '' THEN CAST(SUBSTR(time, INSTR(time, ':') + 1, INSTR(time, '.') - INSTR(time, ':') - 1) AS FLOAT) ELSE 0 END + CASE WHEN SUBSTR(time, INSTR(time, '.') + 1) <> '' THEN CAST(SUBSTR(time, INSTR(time, '.') + 1) AS FLOAT) / 1000 ELSE 0 END) AS time_in_seconds FROM lapTimes) SELECT T2.forename, T2.surname, T1.driverId FROM (SELECT driverId, MIN(time_in_seconds) AS min_time_in_seconds FROM lap_times_in_seconds GROUP BY driverId) AS T1 INNER JOIN drivers AS T2 ON T1.driverId = T2.driverId ORDER BY T1.min_time_in_seconds ASC LIMIT 20

【用户问题】
Please list the lap records for the circuits in Italy.

```sql
output:
WITH `fastest_lap_times` AS (
  SELECT
    `T1`.`raceId`,
    `T1`.`FastestLapTime`,
    (
      CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, 1, INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, ':') - 1) AS DOUBLE) * 60
    ) + (
      CAST(SUBSTR(
        `T1`.`FastestLapTime`,
        INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, ':') + 1,
        INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, '.') - INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, ':') - 1
      ) AS DOUBLE)
    ) + (
      CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, '.') + 1) AS DOUBLE) / 1000
    ) AS `time_in_seconds`
  FROM `results` AS `T1`
  WHERE
    NOT `T1`.`FastestLapTime` IS NULL
)
SELECT
  `T1`.`FastestLapTime` AS `lap_record`
FROM `results` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
INNER JOIN `circuits` AS `T3`
  ON `T2`.`circuitId` = `T3`.`circuitId`
INNER JOIN (
  SELECT
    MIN(`fastest_lap_times`.`time_in_seconds`) AS `min_time_in_seconds`
  FROM `fastest_lap_times`
  INNER JOIN `races` AS `T2`
    ON `fastest_lap_times`.`raceId` = `T2`.`raceId`
  INNER JOIN `circuits` AS `T3`
    ON `T2`.`circuitId` = `T3`.`circuitId`
  WHERE
    `T3`.`country` = 'Italy'
) AS `T4`
  ON (
    CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, 1, INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, ':') - 1) AS DOUBLE) * 60
  ) + (
    CAST(SUBSTR(
      `T1`.`FastestLapTime`,
      INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, ':') + 1,
      INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, '.') - INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, ':') - 1
    ) AS DOUBLE)
  ) + (
    CAST(SUBSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, INSTR(`T1`.`FastestLapTime`, '.') + 1) AS DOUBLE) / 1000
  ) = `T4`.`min_time_in_seconds`
LIMIT 1

【数据库schema】
CREATE TABLE `alignment` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the alignment',
  `alignment` TEXT COMMENT 'the alignment of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
Alignment refers to a characters moral and ethical stance and can be used to describe the overall attitude or behavior of a superhero. Some common alignments for superheroes include:
Good: These superheroes are typically kind, selfless, and dedicated to protecting others and upholding justice. Examples of good alignments include Superman, Wonder Woman, and Spider-Man.
Neutral: These superheroes may not always prioritize the greater good, but they are not necessarily evil either. They may act in their own self-interest or make decisions based on their own moral code. Examples of neutral alignments include the Hulk and Deadpool.
	Bad: These superheroes are typically selfish, manipulative, and willing to harm others in pursuit of their own goals. Examples of evil alignments include Lex Luthor and the Joker.'
);
CREATE TABLE `attribute` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the attribute',
  `attribute_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the attribute; commonsense evidence:
A superheros attribute is a characteristic or quality that defines who they are and what they are capable of. This could be a physical trait, such as superhuman strength or the ability to fly, or a personal trait, such as extraordinary intelligence or exceptional bravery.'
);

  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the color',
  `colour` TEXT COMMENT 'the color of the superheros skin/eye/hair/etc'
);

  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the gender',
  `gender` TEXT COMMENT 'the gender of the superhero'

CREATE TABLE `hero_attribute` (
  `hero_id` TEXT COMMENT 'the id of the hero
Maps to superhero(id)',
  `attribute_id` TEXT COMMENT 'the id of the attribute

你是一名MySQL专家，现在需要阅读并理解下面的【数据库schema】描述，以及可能用到的【参考信息】，并运用MySQL知识生成sql语句回答【用户问题】。
【用户问题】
In superheroes with missing weight data, calculate the difference between the number of superheroes with blue eyes and no eye color.

【数据库schema】
CREATE TABLE `alignment` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the alignment',
  `alignment` TEXT COMMENT 'the alignment of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
Alignment refers to a characters moral and ethical stance and can be used to describe the overall attitude or behavior of a superhero. Some common alignments for superheroes include:
Good: These superheroes are typically kind, selfless, and dedicated to protecting others and upholding justice. Examples of good alignments include Superman, Wonder Woman, and Spider-Man.
Neutral: These superheroes may not always prioritize the greater good, but they are not necessarily evil either. They may act in their own self-interest or make decisions based on their own moral code. Examples of neutral alignments include the Hulk and Deadpool.
	Bad: These superheroes are typically selfish, manipulative, and willing to harm others in pursuit of their own goals. Examples of evil alignments include Lex Luthor and the Joker.'
);
CREATE TABLE `attribute` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the attribute',
  `attribute_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the attribute; commonsense evidence:
A superheros attribute is a characteristic or quality that defines who they are and what they are capable of. This could be a physical trait, such as superhuman strength or the ability to fly, or a personal trait, such as extraordinary intelligence or exceptional bravery.'
);
CREATE TABLE `colour` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the color',
  `colour` TEXT COMMENT 'the color of the superheros skin/eye/hair/etc'
);
CREATE TABLE `gender` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the gender',
  `gender` TEXT COMMENT 'the gender of the superhero'
);
CREATE TABLE `hero_attribute` (
  `hero_id` TEXT COMMENT 'the id of the hero
Maps to superhero(id)',
  `attribute_id` TEXT COMMENT 'the id of the attribute
Maps to attribute(id)',
  `attribute_value` TEXT COMMENT 'the attribute value; commonsense evidence:
If a superhero has a higher attribute value on a particular attribute, it means that they are more skilled or powerful in that area compared to other superheroes. For example, if a superhero has a higher attribute value for strength, they may be able to lift heavier objects or deliver more powerful punches than other superheroes.'
);
CREATE TABLE `hero_power` (
  `hero_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the hero
Maps to superhero(id)',
  `power_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the power
Maps to superpower(id); commonsense evidence:
In general, a superheros attributes provide the foundation for their abilities and help to define who they are, while their powers are the specific abilities that they use to fight crime and protect others.'
);
CREATE TABLE `publisher` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the publisher',
  `publisher_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the name of the publisher'
);
CREATE TABLE `race` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the race',
  `race` TEXT COMMENT 'the race of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
In the context of superheroes, a superheros race would refer to the particular group of people that the superhero belongs to base on these physical characteristics'
);
CREATE TABLE `superhero` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the superhero',
  `superhero_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the name of the superhero',
  `full_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the full name of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
The full name of a person typically consists of their given name, also known as their first name or personal name, and their surname, also known as their last name or family name. For example, if someones given name is "John" and their surname is "Smith," their full name would be "John Smith."',
  `gender_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros gender',
  `eye_colour_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros eye color',
  `hair_colour_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros hair color',
  `skin_colour_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros skin color',
  `race_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros race',
  `publisher_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the publisher',
  `alignment_id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the superheros alignment',
  `height_cm` BIGINT COMMENT 'the height of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
The unit of height is centimeter. If the height_cm is NULL or 0, it means the height of the superhero is missing.',
  `weight_kg` BIGINT COMMENT 'the weight of the superhero; commonsense evidence:
The unit of weight is kilogram. If the weight_kg is NULL or 0, it means the weight of the superhero is missing.'
);
CREATE TABLE `superpower` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique identifier of the superpower',
  `power_name` TEXT COMMENT 'the superpower name'
);

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
In superheroes with missing weight data, calculate the difference between the number of superheroes with blue eyes and no eye color.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`id` = 7 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) - SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`id` = 1 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END)
FROM `superhero` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `colour` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`eye_colour_id` = `T2`.`id`
WHERE
  `T1`.`weight_kg` = 0 OR `T1`.`weight_kg` IS NULL

你是一名MySQL专家，现在需要阅读并理解下面的【数据库schema】描述，以及可能用到的【参考信息】，并运用MySQL知识生成sql语句回答【用户问题】。
【用户问题】
Which user has a higher reputation, Harlan or Jarrod Dixon?

【数据库schema】
CREATE TABLE `badges` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the badge id',
  `UserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id of the user',
  `Name` TEXT COMMENT 'the badge name the user obtained',
  `Date` TEXT COMMENT 'the date that the user obtained the badge'
);
CREATE TABLE `comments` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the comment Id',
  `PostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id of the post',
  `Score` BIGINT COMMENT 'rating score; commonsense evidence:
The score is from 0 to 100. The score more than 60 refers that the comment is a positive comment. The score less than 60 refers that the comment is a negative comment.',
  `Text` TEXT COMMENT 'the detailed content of the comment',
  `CreationDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the comment',
  `UserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the user who post the comment',
  `UserDisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'users display name'
);
CREATE TABLE `postHistory` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the post history id',
  `PostHistoryTypeId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the post history type',
  `PostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id of the post',
  `RevisionGUID` BIGINT COMMENT 'the revision globally unique id of the post',
  `CreationDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the post',
  `UserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the user who post the post',
  `Text` TEXT COMMENT 'the detailed content of the post',
  `Comment` TEXT COMMENT 'comments of the post',
  `UserDisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'users display name'
);
CREATE TABLE `postLinks` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the post link id',
  `CreationDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the post link',
  `PostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the post id',
  `RelatedPostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the related post',
  `LinkTypeId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the link type'
);
CREATE TABLE `posts` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the post id',
  `PostTypeId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the post type',
  `AcceptedAnswerId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the accepted answer id of the post',
  `CreaionDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the post',
  `Score` BIGINT COMMENT 'the score of the post',
  `ViewCount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the view count of the post; commonsense evidence:
Higher view count means the post has higher popularity',
  `Body` TEXT COMMENT 'the body of the post',
  `OwnerUserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the owner user',
  `LasActivityDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the last activity date',
  `Title` TEXT COMMENT 'the title of the post',
  `Tags` TEXT COMMENT 'the tag of the post',
  `AnswerCount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the total number of answers of the post',
  `CommentCount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the total number of comments of the post',
  `FavoriteCount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the total number of favorites of the post; commonsense evidence:
more favorite count refers to more valuable posts.',
  `LastEditorUserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the last editor',
  `LastEditDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the last edit date',
  `CommunityOwnedDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the community owned date',
  `ParentId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the parent post; commonsense evidence:
If the parent id is null, the post is the root post. Otherwise, the post is the child post of other post.',
  `ClosedDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the closed date of the post; commonsense evidence:
if ClosedDate is null or empty, it means this post is not well-finished
if CloseDate is not null or empty, it means this post has well-finished.',
  `OwnerDisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'the display name of the post owner',
  `LastEditorDisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'the display name of the last editor'
);
CREATE TABLE `tags` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the tag id',
  `TagName` TEXT COMMENT 'the name of the tag',
  `Count` BIGINT COMMENT 'the count of posts that contain this tag; more counts --> this tag is more popular',
  `ExcerptPostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the excerpt post id of the tag',
  `WikiPostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the wiki post id of the tag'
);
CREATE TABLE `users` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the user id',
  `Reputation` BIGINT COMMENT 'the users reputation; commonsense evidence:
The user with higher reputation has more influence.',
  `CreationDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the user account',
  `DisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'the users display name',
  `LastAccessDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the last access date of the user account',
  `WebsiteUrl` TEXT COMMENT 'the website url of the user account',
  `Location` TEXT COMMENT 'users location',
  `AboutMe` TEXT COMMENT 'the self introduction of the user',
  `Views` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number of views',
  `UpVotes` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number of upvotes',
  `DownVotes` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number of downvotes',
  `AccountId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id of the account',
  `Age` BIGINT COMMENT 'users age;  teenager: 13-18
 adult: 19-65
 elder: > 65',
  `ProfileImageUrl` TEXT COMMENT 'the profile image url'
);
CREATE TABLE `votes` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the vote id',
  `PostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the post that is voted',
  `VoteTypeId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the vote type',
  `CreationDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the vote',
  `UserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the voter',
  `BountyAmount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the amount of bounty'
);

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
Which user has a higher reputation, Harlan or Jarrod Dixon?

```sql
output:
SELECT
  `DisplayName`
FROM `users`
WHERE
  `DisplayName` IN ('Harlan', 'Jarrod Dixon')
  AND `Reputation` = (
    SELECT
      MAX(`Reputation`)
    FROM `users`
    WHERE
      `DisplayName` IN ('Harlan', 'Jarrod Dixon')
  )

SELECT

) AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`Id` = `T2`.`OwnerUserId`

Among all the posts posted by the most influential user, identify the percentage with a score above 50.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`Score` > 50 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T1`.`Id`)
FROM `users` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `posts` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`Id` = `T2`.`OwnerUserId`
INNER JOIN (
  SELECT
    MAX(`Reputation`) AS `max_reputation`
  FROM `users`
) AS `T3`
  ON `T1`.`Reputation` = `T3`.`max_reputation`

  `UserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id of the user',
  `Name` TEXT COMMENT 'the badge name the user obtained',
  `Date` TEXT COMMENT 'the date that the user obtained the badge'
);
CREATE TABLE `comments` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the comment Id',
  `PostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id of the post',
  `Score` BIGINT COMMENT 'rating score; commonsense evidence:
The score is from 0 to 100. The score more than 60 refers that the comment is a positive comment. The score less than 60 refers that the comment is a negative comment.',
  `Text` TEXT COMMENT 'the detailed content of the comment',
  `CreationDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the comment',
  `UserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the user who post the comment',
  `UserDisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'users display name'
);

  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the post history id',

);

  `LinkTypeId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the link type'
);
CREATE TABLE `posts` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the post id',
  `PostTypeId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the post type',
  `AcceptedAnswerId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the accepted answer id of the post',
  `CreaionDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the post',
  `Score` BIGINT COMMENT 'the score of the post',
  `ViewCount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the view count of the post; commonsense evidence:
Higher view count means the post has higher popularity',
  `Body` TEXT COMMENT 'the body of the post',
  `OwnerUserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the owner user',
  `LasActivityDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the last activity date',
  `Title` TEXT COMMENT 'the title of the post',
  `Tags` TEXT COMMENT 'the tag of the post',
  `AnswerCount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the total number of answers of the post',
  `CommentCount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the total number of comments of the post',
  `FavoriteCount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the total number of favorites of the post; commonsense evidence:
more favorite count refers to more valuable posts.',
  `LastEditorUserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the last editor',
  `LastEditDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the last edit date',
  `CommunityOwnedDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the community owned date',
  `ParentId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the parent post; commonsense evidence:
If the parent id is null, the post is the root post. Otherwise, the post is the child post of other post.',
  `ClosedDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the closed date of the post; commonsense evidence:
if ClosedDate is null or empty, it means this post is not well-finished
if CloseDate is not null or empty, it means this post has well-finished.',
  `OwnerDisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'the display name of the post owner',
  `LastEditorDisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'the display name of the last editor'
);
CREATE TABLE `tags` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the tag id',
  `TagName` TEXT COMMENT 'the name of the tag',
  `Count` BIGINT COMMENT 'the count of posts that contain this tag; more counts --> this tag is more popular',
  `ExcerptPostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the excerpt post id of the tag',
  `WikiPostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the wiki post id of the tag'
);
CREATE TABLE `users` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the user id',
  `Reputation` BIGINT COMMENT 'the users reputation; commonsense evidence:
The user with higher reputation has more influence.',
  `CreationDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the user account',
  `DisplayName` TEXT COMMENT 'the users display name',
  `LastAccessDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the last access date of the user account',
  `WebsiteUrl` TEXT COMMENT 'the website url of the user account',
  `Location` TEXT COMMENT 'users location',
  `AboutMe` TEXT COMMENT 'the self introduction of the user',
  `Views` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number of views',
  `UpVotes` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number of upvotes',
  `DownVotes` BIGINT COMMENT 'the number of downvotes',
  `AccountId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the unique id of the account',
  `Age` BIGINT COMMENT 'users age;  teenager: 13-18
 adult: 19-65
 elder: > 65',
  `ProfileImageUrl` TEXT COMMENT 'the profile image url'
);
CREATE TABLE `votes` (
  `Id` BIGINT COMMENT 'the vote id',
  `PostId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the post that is voted',
  `VoteTypeId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the vote type',
  `CreationDate` TEXT COMMENT 'the creation date of the vote',
  `UserId` BIGINT COMMENT 'the id of the voter',
  `BountyAmount` BIGINT COMMENT 'the amount of bounty'
);

【用户问题】
In posts with 1 comment, how many of the comments have 0 score?

```sql
output:
SELECT
  COUNT(`T1`.`id`)
FROM `comments` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `posts` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`PostId` = `T2`.`Id`
WHERE
  `T2`.`CommentCount` = 1 AND `T2`.`Score` = 0

【用户问题】
Among the comments with scores between 5 to 10, what is the percentage of the users with 0 up votes?

```sql
output:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `T1`.`UpVotes` = 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T1`.`Id`) AS `per`
FROM `users` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `comments` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`Id` = `T2`.`UserId`
WHERE
  `T2`.`Score` BETWEEN 5 AND 10

input:
你是一名MySQL专家，现在需要阅读并理解下面的【数据库schema】描述，以及可能用到的【参考信息】，并运用MySQL知识生成sql语句回答【用户问题】。
【用户问题】
Which are the cards that have incredibly powerful foils.

【数据库schema】
CREATE TABLE `cards` (
  `id` BIGINT,
  `artist` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the artist that illustrated the card art.',
  `asciiName` TEXT COMMENT 'The ASCII(opens new window) (Basic/128) code formatted card name with no special unicode characters.',
  `availability` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of the cards available printing types.; "arena", "dreamcast", "mtgo", "paper", "shandalar"',
  `borderColor` TEXT COMMENT 'The color of the card border.; "black", "borderless", "gold", "silver", "white"',
  `cardKingdomFoilId` TEXT COMMENT 'card Kingdom Foil Id; commonsense evidence:
cardKingdomFoilId, when paired with cardKingdomId that is not Null, is incredibly powerful.',
  `cardKingdomId` TEXT COMMENT 'card Kingdom Id; A list of all the colors in the color indicator',
  `colorIdentity` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of all the colors found in manaCost, colorIndicator, and text',
  `colorIndicator` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of all the colors in the color indicator (The symbol prefixed to a cards types).',
  `colors` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of all the colors in manaCost and colorIndicator.; Some cards may not have values, such as cards with "Devoid" in its text.',
  `convertedManaCost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The converted mana cost of the card. Use the manaValue property.; if value is higher, it means that this card cost more converted mana',
  `duelDeck` TEXT COMMENT 'The indicator for which duel deck the card is in.',
  `edhrecRank` BIGINT COMMENT 'The card rank on EDHRec',
  `faceConvertedManaCost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The converted mana cost or mana value for the face for either half or part of the card.; if value is higher, it means that this card cost more converted mana for the face',
  `faceName` TEXT COMMENT 'The name on the face of the card.',
  `flavorName` TEXT COMMENT 'The promotional card name printed above the true card name on special cards that has no game function.; The promotional card name printed above the true card name on special cards that has no game function.',
  `flavorText` TEXT COMMENT 'The italicized text found below the rules text that has no game function.; The italicized text found below the rules text that has no game function.',
  `frameEffects` TEXT COMMENT 'The visual frame effects.; "colorshifted", "companion", "compasslanddfc", "devoid", "draft", "etched", "extendedart", "fullart", "inverted", "legendary", "lesson", "miracle", "mooneldrazidfc", "nyxtouched", "originpwdfc", "showcase", "snow", "sunmoondfc", "textless", "tombstone", "waxingandwaningmoondfc"',
  `frameVersion` TEXT COMMENT 'The version of the card frame style.; "1993", "1997", "2003", "2015", "future"',
  `hand` TEXT COMMENT 'The starting maximum hand size total modifier.; A + or - character precedes an integer. 
commonsense evidence:
positive maximum hand size: +1, +2, ....
negative maximum hand size: -1, ....
neural maximum hand size: 0....',
  `hasAlternativeDeckLimit` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card allows a value other than 4 copies in a deck.; 0: disallow 1: allow',
  `hasContentWarning` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card marked by Wizards of the Coast (opens new window) for having sensitive content. See this official article (opens new window) for more information.; 0: doesnt have 1: has sensitve content or Wizards of the Coast
commonsense evidence:
Cards with this property may have missing or degraded properties and values.',
  `hasFoil` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card can be found in foil; 0: cannot be found 1: can be found',
  `hasNonFoil` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card can be found in non-foil; 0: cannot be found 1: can be found',
  `isAlternative` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is an alternate variation to an original printing; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isFullArt` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card has full artwork.; 0: doesnt have, 1: has full artwork',
  `isOnlineOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is only available in online game variations.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isOversized` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is oversized.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isPromo` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is a promotional printing.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isReprint` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card has been reprinted.; 0: has not 1: has not been',
  `isReserved` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is on the Magic: The Gathering Reserved List (opens new window); If the card is on the Magic, it will appear in The Gathering Reserved List',
  `isStarter` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is found in a starter deck such as Planeswalker/Brawl decks.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isStorySpotlight` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is a Story Spotlight card.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isTextless` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card does not have a text box.; commonsense evidence:
0: has a text box;
1: doesnt have a text box;',
  `isTimeshifted` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is time shifted; commonsense evidence:
If the card is "timeshifted", a feature of certain sets where a card will have a different frameVersion.',
  `keywords` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of keywords found on the card.',
  `layout` TEXT COMMENT 'The type of card layout. For a token card, this will be "token"',
  `leadershipSkills` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of formats the card is legal to be a commander in',
  `life` TEXT COMMENT 'The starting life total modifier. A plus or minus character precedes an integer.',
  `loyalty` TEXT COMMENT 'The starting loyalty value of the card.; Used only on cards with "Planeswalker" in its types. empty means unkown',
  `manaCost` TEXT COMMENT 'The mana cost of the card wrapped in brackets for each value.; commonsense evidence:
manaCost is unconverted mana cost',
  `mcmId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mcmMetaId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mtgArenaId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mtgjsonV4Id` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mtgoFoilId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mtgoId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `multiverseId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the card.; Cards with multiple faces, like "Split" and "Meld" cards are given a delimiter.',
  `number` TEXT COMMENT 'The number of the card',
  `originalReleaseDate` TEXT COMMENT 'original Release Date; The original release date in ISO 8601(opens new window) format for a promotional card printed outside of a cycle window, such as Secret Lair Drop promotions.',
  `originalText` TEXT COMMENT 'original Text; The text on the card as originally printed.',
  `originalType` TEXT COMMENT 'original Type; The type of the card as originally printed. Includes any supertypes and subtypes.',
  `otherFaceIds` TEXT COMMENT 'other Face Ids; A list of card UUIDs to this cards counterparts, such as transformed or melded faces.',
  `power` TEXT COMMENT 'The power of the card.; commonsense evidence:
∞ means infinite power
null or * refers to unknown power',
  `printings` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of set printing codes the card was printed in, formatted in uppercase.',
  `promoTypes` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of promotional types for a card.; "arenaleague", "boosterfun", "boxtopper", "brawldeck", "bundle", "buyabox", "convention", "datestamped", "draculaseries", "draftweekend", "duels", "event", "fnm", "gameday", "gateway", "giftbox", "gilded", "godzillaseries", "instore", "intropack", "jpwalker", "judgegift", "league", "mediainsert", "neonink", "openhouse", "planeswalkerstamped", "playerrewards", "playpromo", "premiereshop", "prerelease", "promopack", "release", "setpromo", "stamped", "textured", "themepack", "thick", "tourney", "wizardsplaynetwork"',
  `purchaseUrls` TEXT COMMENT 'Links that navigate to websites where the card can be purchased.',
  `rarity` TEXT COMMENT 'The card printing rarity.',
  `scryfallId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `scryfallIllustrationId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `scryfallOracleId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `setCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The set printing code that the card is from.',
  `side` TEXT COMMENT 'The identifier of the card side.; Used on cards with multiple faces on the same card.
commonsense evidence:
if this value is empty, then it means this card doesnt have multiple faces on the same card.',
  `subtypes` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of card subtypes found after em-dash.',
  `supertypes` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of card supertypes found before em-dash.; commonsense evidence:
list of all types should be the union of subtypes and supertypes',
  `tcgplayerProductId` TEXT,
  `text` TEXT COMMENT 'The rules text of the card.',
  `toughness` TEXT COMMENT 'The toughness of the card.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The type of the card as visible, including any supertypes and subtypes.; "Artifact", "Card", "Conspiracy", "Creature", "Dragon", "Dungeon", "Eaturecray", "Elemental", "Elite", "Emblem", "Enchantment", "Ever", "Goblin", "Hero", "Instant", "Jaguar", "Knights", "Land", "Phenomenon", "Plane", "Planeswalker", "Scariest", "Scheme", "See", "Sorcery", "Sticker", "Summon", "Token", "Tribal", "Vanguard", "Wolf", "You’ll", "instant"',
  `types` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of all card types of the card, including Un‑sets and gameplay variants.',
  `uuid` TEXT COMMENT 'The universal unique identifier (v5) generated by MTGJSON. Each entry is unique.; NOT USEFUL',
  `variations` TEXT,
  `watermark` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the watermark on the card.'
);
CREATE TABLE `foreign_data` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id number identifying this row of data',
  `flavorText` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign flavor text of the card.',
  `language` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign language of card.',
  `multiverseid` BIGINT COMMENT 'The foreign multiverse identifier of the card.',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign name of the card.',
  `text` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign text ruling of the card.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign type of the card. Includes any supertypes and subtypes.',
  `uuid` TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE `legalities` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this legality',
  `format` TEXT COMMENT 'format of play; each value refers to different rules to play',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT '• legal
• banned
• restricted',
  `uuid` TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE `rulings` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this ruling',
  `date` TEXT COMMENT 'date',
  `text` TEXT COMMENT 'description about this ruling',
  `uuid` TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE `set_translations` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this set',
  `language` TEXT COMMENT 'language of this card',
  `setCode` TEXT COMMENT 'the set code for this set',
  `translation` TEXT COMMENT 'translation of this card'
);
CREATE TABLE `sets` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this set',
  `baseSetSize` BIGINT COMMENT 'The number of cards in the set.',
  `block` TEXT COMMENT 'The block name the set was in.',
  `booster` TEXT COMMENT 'A breakdown of possibilities and weights of cards in a booster pack.',
  `code` TEXT COMMENT 'The set code for the set.',
  `isFoilOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in foil.',
  `isForeignOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is available only outside the United States of America.',
  `isNonFoilOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in non-foil.',
  `isOnlineOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in online game variations.',
  `isPartialPreview` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is still in preview (spoiled). Preview sets do not have complete data.',
  `keyruneCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The matching Keyrune code for set image icons.',
  `mcmId` BIGINT COMMENT 'The Magic Card Marketset identifier.',
  `mcmIdExtras` BIGINT COMMENT 'The split Magic Card Market set identifier if a set is printed in two sets. This identifier represents the second sets identifier.',
  `mcmName` TEXT,
  `mtgoCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The set code for the set as it appears on Magic: The Gathering Online; commonsense evidence:
if the value is null or empty, then it doesnt appear on Magic: The Gathering Online',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the set.',
  `parentCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The parent set code for set variations like promotions, guild kits, etc.',
  `releaseDate` TEXT COMMENT 'The release date in ISO 8601 format for the set.',
  `tcgplayerGroupId` BIGINT COMMENT 'The group identifier of the set on TCGplayer',
  `totalSetSize` BIGINT COMMENT 'The total number of cards in the set, including promotional and related supplemental products but excluding Alchemy modifications - however those cards are included in the set itself.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The expansion type of the set.; "alchemy", "archenemy", "arsenal", "box", "commander", "core", "draft_innovation", "duel_deck", "expansion", "from_the_vault", "funny", "masterpiece", "masters", "memorabilia", "planechase", "premium_deck", "promo", "spellbook", "starter", "token", "treasure_chest", "vanguard"'
);

【用户问题】
What are the borderless cards available without powerful foils?

```sql
output:
SELECT
  `id`
FROM `cards`
WHERE
  `borderColor` = 'borderless'
  AND (
    `cardKingdomId` IS NULL OR `cardKingdomId` IS NULL
  )

【用户问题】
List all the mythic rarity print cards banned in gladiator format.

```sql
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T1`.`id`
FROM `cards` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `legalities` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`uuid` = `T2`.`uuid`
WHERE
  `T2`.`format` = 'gladiator'
  AND `T2`.`status` = 'Banned'
  AND `T1`.`rarity` = 'mythic'

【用户问题】
For artifact type of cards that do not have multiple faces on the same card, state its legalities status for vintage play format.

```sql
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `T2`.`status`
FROM `cards` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `legalities` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`uuid` = `T2`.`uuid`
WHERE
  `T1`.`type` = 'Artifact' AND `T2`.`format` = 'vintage' AND `T1`.`side` IS NULL

【用户问题】
List all the card id and artist with unknown power which are legal for commander play format.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  `T1`.`id`,
  `T1`.`artist`
FROM `cards` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `legalities` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`uuid` = `T2`.`uuid`
WHERE
  `T2`.`status` = 'Legal'
  AND `T2`.`format` = 'commander'
  AND (
    `T1`.`power` IS NULL OR `T1`.`power` = '*'
  )

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
Find all cards illustrated by Stephen Daniel and describe the text of the ruling of these cards. State if these cards have missing or degraded properties and values.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  `T1`.`id`,
  `T2`.`text`,
  `T1`.`hasContentWarning`
FROM `cards` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `rulings` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`uuid` = `T2`.`uuid`
WHERE
  `T1`.`artist` = 'Stephen Daniele'

【用户问题】
Name the card and artist with the most ruling information. Also state if the card is a promotional printing.

```sql
output: SELECT `T1`.`name`, `T1`.`artist`, `T1`.`isPromo` FROM `cards` AS `T1` INNER JOIN `rulings` AS `T2` ON `T1`.`uuid` = `T2`.`uuid` WHERE `T1`.`isPromo` = 1 AND `T1`.`artist` = ( SELECT `artist` FROM `cards` WHERE `isPromo` = 1 GROUP BY `artist` HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT `uuid`) = (SELECT MAX(card_counts.max_count) FROM (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT `uuid`) AS max_count FROM `cards` WHERE `isPromo` = 1 GROUP BY `artist`) AS card_counts))LIMIT 1

【用户问题】
Calculate the percentage of the cards availabe in Chinese Simplified.

【数据库schema】
CREATE TABLE `cards` (
  `id` BIGINT,
  `artist` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the artist that illustrated the card art.',
  `asciiName` TEXT COMMENT 'The ASCII(opens new window) (Basic/128) code formatted card name with no special unicode characters.',
  `availability` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of the cards available printing types.; "arena", "dreamcast", "mtgo", "paper", "shandalar"',
  `borderColor` TEXT COMMENT 'The color of the card border.; "black", "borderless", "gold", "silver", "white"',
  `cardKingdomFoilId` TEXT COMMENT 'card Kingdom Foil Id; commonsense evidence:
cardKingdomFoilId, when paired with cardKingdomId that is not Null, is incredibly powerful.',
  `cardKingdomId` TEXT COMMENT 'card Kingdom Id; A list of all the colors in the color indicator',
  `colorIdentity` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of all the colors found in manaCost, colorIndicator, and text',
  `colorIndicator` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of all the colors in the color indicator (The symbol prefixed to a cards types).',
  `colors` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of all the colors in manaCost and colorIndicator.; Some cards may not have values, such as cards with "Devoid" in its text.',
  `convertedManaCost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The converted mana cost of the card. Use the manaValue property.; if value is higher, it means that this card cost more converted mana',
  `duelDeck` TEXT COMMENT 'The indicator for which duel deck the card is in.',
  `edhrecRank` BIGINT COMMENT 'The card rank on EDHRec',
  `faceConvertedManaCost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The converted mana cost or mana value for the face for either half or part of the card.; if value is higher, it means that this card cost more converted mana for the face',
  `faceName` TEXT COMMENT 'The name on the face of the card.',
  `flavorName` TEXT COMMENT 'The promotional card name printed above the true card name on special cards that has no game function.; The promotional card name printed above the true card name on special cards that has no game function.',
  `flavorText` TEXT COMMENT 'The italicized text found below the rules text that has no game function.; The italicized text found below the rules text that has no game function.',
  `frameEffects` TEXT COMMENT 'The visual frame effects.; "colorshifted", "companion", "compasslanddfc", "devoid", "draft", "etched", "extendedart", "fullart", "inverted", "legendary", "lesson", "miracle", "mooneldrazidfc", "nyxtouched", "originpwdfc", "showcase", "snow", "sunmoondfc", "textless", "tombstone", "waxingandwaningmoondfc"',
  `frameVersion` TEXT COMMENT 'The version of the card frame style.; "1993", "1997", "2003", "2015", "future"',
  `hand` TEXT COMMENT 'The starting maximum hand size total modifier.; A + or - character precedes an integer. 
commonsense evidence:
positive maximum hand size: +1, +2, ....
negative maximum hand size: -1, ....
neural maximum hand size: 0....',
  `hasAlternativeDeckLimit` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card allows a value other than 4 copies in a deck.; 0: disallow 1: allow',
  `hasContentWarning` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card marked by Wizards of the Coast (opens new window) for having sensitive content. See this official article (opens new window) for more information.; 0: doesnt have 1: has sensitve content or Wizards of the Coast
commonsense evidence:
Cards with this property may have missing or degraded properties and values.',
  `hasFoil` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card can be found in foil; 0: cannot be found 1: can be found',
  `hasNonFoil` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card can be found in non-foil; 0: cannot be found 1: can be found',
  `isAlternative` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is an alternate variation to an original printing; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isFullArt` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card has full artwork.; 0: doesnt have, 1: has full artwork',
  `isOnlineOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is only available in online game variations.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isOversized` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is oversized.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isPromo` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is a promotional printing.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isReprint` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card has been reprinted.; 0: has not 1: has not been',
  `isReserved` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is on the Magic: The Gathering Reserved List (opens new window); If the card is on the Magic, it will appear in The Gathering Reserved List',
  `isStarter` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is found in a starter deck such as Planeswalker/Brawl decks.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isStorySpotlight` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is a Story Spotlight card.; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isTextless` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card does not have a text box.; commonsense evidence:
0: has a text box;
1: doesnt have a text box;',
  `isTimeshifted` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is time shifted; commonsense evidence:
If the card is "timeshifted", a feature of certain sets where a card will have a different frameVersion.',
  `keywords` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of keywords found on the card.',
  `layout` TEXT COMMENT 'The type of card layout. For a token card, this will be "token"',
  `leadershipSkills` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of formats the card is legal to be a commander in',
  `life` TEXT COMMENT 'The starting life total modifier. A plus or minus character precedes an integer.',
  `loyalty` TEXT COMMENT 'The starting loyalty value of the card.; Used only on cards with "Planeswalker" in its types. empty means unkown',
  `manaCost` TEXT COMMENT 'The mana cost of the card wrapped in brackets for each value.; commonsense evidence:
manaCost is unconverted mana cost',
  `mcmId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mcmMetaId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mtgArenaId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mtgjsonV4Id` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mtgoFoilId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `mtgoId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `multiverseId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the card.; Cards with multiple faces, like "Split" and "Meld" cards are given a delimiter.',
  `number` TEXT COMMENT 'The number of the card',
  `originalReleaseDate` TEXT COMMENT 'original Release Date; The original release date in ISO 8601(opens new window) format for a promotional card printed outside of a cycle window, such as Secret Lair Drop promotions.',
  `originalText` TEXT COMMENT 'original Text; The text on the card as originally printed.',
  `originalType` TEXT COMMENT 'original Type; The type of the card as originally printed. Includes any supertypes and subtypes.',
  `otherFaceIds` TEXT COMMENT 'other Face Ids; A list of card UUIDs to this cards counterparts, such as transformed or melded faces.',
  `power` TEXT COMMENT 'The power of the card.; commonsense evidence:
∞ means infinite power
null or * refers to unknown power',
  `printings` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of set printing codes the card was printed in, formatted in uppercase.',
  `promoTypes` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of promotional types for a card.; "arenaleague", "boosterfun", "boxtopper", "brawldeck", "bundle", "buyabox", "convention", "datestamped", "draculaseries", "draftweekend", "duels", "event", "fnm", "gameday", "gateway", "giftbox", "gilded", "godzillaseries", "instore", "intropack", "jpwalker", "judgegift", "league", "mediainsert", "neonink", "openhouse", "planeswalkerstamped", "playerrewards", "playpromo", "premiereshop", "prerelease", "promopack", "release", "setpromo", "stamped", "textured", "themepack", "thick", "tourney", "wizardsplaynetwork"',
  `purchaseUrls` TEXT COMMENT 'Links that navigate to websites where the card can be purchased.',
  `rarity` TEXT COMMENT 'The card printing rarity.',
  `scryfallId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `scryfallIllustrationId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `scryfallOracleId` TEXT COMMENT 'NOT USEFUL',
  `setCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The set printing code that the card is from.',
  `side` TEXT COMMENT 'The identifier of the card side.; Used on cards with multiple faces on the same card.
commonsense evidence:
if this value is empty, then it means this card doesnt have multiple faces on the same card.',
  `subtypes` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of card subtypes found after em-dash.',
  `supertypes` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of card supertypes found before em-dash.; commonsense evidence:
list of all types should be the union of subtypes and supertypes',
  `tcgplayerProductId` TEXT,
  `text` TEXT COMMENT 'The rules text of the card.',
  `toughness` TEXT COMMENT 'The toughness of the card.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The type of the card as visible, including any supertypes and subtypes.; "Artifact", "Card", "Conspiracy", "Creature", "Dragon", "Dungeon", "Eaturecray", "Elemental", "Elite", "Emblem", "Enchantment", "Ever", "Goblin", "Hero", "Instant", "Jaguar", "Knights", "Land", "Phenomenon", "Plane", "Planeswalker", "Scariest", "Scheme", "See", "Sorcery", "Sticker", "Summon", "Token", "Tribal", "Vanguard", "Wolf", "You’ll", "instant"',
  `types` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of all card types of the card, including Un‑sets and gameplay variants.',
  `uuid` TEXT COMMENT 'The universal unique identifier (v5) generated by MTGJSON. Each entry is unique.; NOT USEFUL',
  `variations` TEXT,
  `watermark` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the watermark on the card.'
);
CREATE TABLE `foreign_data` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id number identifying this row of data',
  `flavorText` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign flavor text of the card.',
  `language` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign language of card.',
  `multiverseid` BIGINT COMMENT 'The foreign multiverse identifier of the card.',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign name of the card.',
  `text` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign text ruling of the card.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign type of the card. Includes any supertypes and subtypes.',
  `uuid` TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE `legalities` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this legality',
  `format` TEXT COMMENT 'format of play; each value refers to different rules to play',
  `status` TEXT COMMENT '• legal
• banned
• restricted',
  `uuid` TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE `rulings` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this ruling',
  `date` TEXT COMMENT 'date',
  `text` TEXT COMMENT 'description about this ruling',
  `uuid` TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE `set_translations` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this set',
  `language` TEXT COMMENT 'language of this card',
  `setCode` TEXT COMMENT 'the set code for this set',
  `translation` TEXT COMMENT 'translation of this card'
);
CREATE TABLE `sets` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this set',
  `baseSetSize` BIGINT COMMENT 'The number of cards in the set.',
  `block` TEXT COMMENT 'The block name the set was in.',
  `booster` TEXT COMMENT 'A breakdown of possibilities and weights of cards in a booster pack.',
  `code` TEXT COMMENT 'The set code for the set.',
  `isFoilOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in foil.',
  `isForeignOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is available only outside the United States of America.',
  `isNonFoilOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in non-foil.',
  `isOnlineOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in online game variations.',
  `isPartialPreview` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is still in preview (spoiled). Preview sets do not have complete data.',
  `keyruneCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The matching Keyrune code for set image icons.',
  `mcmId` BIGINT COMMENT 'The Magic Card Marketset identifier.',
  `mcmIdExtras` BIGINT COMMENT 'The split Magic Card Market set identifier if a set is printed in two sets. This identifier represents the second sets identifier.',
  `mcmName` TEXT,
  `mtgoCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The set code for the set as it appears on Magic: The Gathering Online; commonsense evidence:
if the value is null or empty, then it doesnt appear on Magic: The Gathering Online',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the set.',
  `parentCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The parent set code for set variations like promotions, guild kits, etc.',
  `releaseDate` TEXT COMMENT 'The release date in ISO 8601 format for the set.',
  `tcgplayerGroupId` BIGINT COMMENT 'The group identifier of the set on TCGplayer',
  `totalSetSize` BIGINT COMMENT 'The total number of cards in the set, including promotional and related supplemental products but excluding Alchemy modifications - however those cards are included in the set itself.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The expansion type of the set.; "alchemy", "archenemy", "arsenal", "box", "commander", "core", "draft_innovation", "duel_deck", "expansion", "from_the_vault", "funny", "masterpiece", "masters", "memorabilia", "planechase", "premium_deck", "promo", "spellbook", "starter", "token", "treasure_chest", "vanguard"'
);

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
Calculate the percentage of the cards availabe in Chinese Simplified.

```sql
output:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`language` = 'Chinese Simplified' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T1`.`id`)
FROM `cards` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `foreign_data` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`uuid` = `T2`.`uuid`

Cards with this property may have missing or degraded properties and values.',

1: doesnt have a text box;',

manaCost is unconverted mana cost',

list of all types should be the union of subtypes and supertypes',

CREATE TABLE `legalities` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this legality',

  `status` TEXT COMMENT '• legal
• banned
• restricted',
  `uuid` TEXT

CREATE TABLE `rulings` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this ruling',
  `date` TEXT COMMENT 'date',
  `text` TEXT COMMENT 'description about this ruling',
  `uuid` TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE `set_translations` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this set',
  `language` TEXT COMMENT 'language of this card',
  `setCode` TEXT COMMENT 'the set code for this set',
  `translation` TEXT COMMENT 'translation of this card'
);
CREATE TABLE `sets` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this set',
  `baseSetSize` BIGINT COMMENT 'The number of cards in the set.',
  `block` TEXT COMMENT 'The block name the set was in.',
  `booster` TEXT COMMENT 'A breakdown of possibilities and weights of cards in a booster pack.',
  `code` TEXT COMMENT 'The set code for the set.',
  `isFoilOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in foil.',
  `isForeignOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is available only outside the United States of America.',
  `isNonFoilOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in non-foil.',
  `isOnlineOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in online game variations.',
  `isPartialPreview` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is still in preview (spoiled). Preview sets do not have complete data.',
  `keyruneCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The matching Keyrune code for set image icons.',
  `mcmId` BIGINT COMMENT 'The Magic Card Marketset identifier.',
  `mcmIdExtras` BIGINT COMMENT 'The split Magic Card Market set identifier if a set is printed in two sets. This identifier represents the second sets identifier.',
  `mcmName` TEXT,
  `mtgoCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The set code for the set as it appears on Magic: The Gathering Online; commonsense evidence:
if the value is null or empty, then it doesnt appear on Magic: The Gathering Online',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the set.',
  `parentCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The parent set code for set variations like promotions, guild kits, etc.',
  `releaseDate` TEXT COMMENT 'The release date in ISO 8601 format for the set.',
  `tcgplayerGroupId` BIGINT COMMENT 'The group identifier of the set on TCGplayer',
  `totalSetSize` BIGINT COMMENT 'The total number of cards in the set, including promotional and related supplemental products but excluding Alchemy modifications - however those cards are included in the set itself.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The expansion type of the set.; "alchemy", "archenemy", "arsenal", "box", "commander", "core", "draft_innovation", "duel_deck", "expansion", "from_the_vault", "funny", "masterpiece", "masters", "memorabilia", "planechase", "premium_deck", "promo", "spellbook", "starter", "token", "treasure_chest", "vanguard"'
);

【用户问题】
What is the border color of card "Ancestor's Chosen"?

```sql
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
  `borderColor`
FROM `cards`
WHERE
  `name` = 'Ancestor''s Chosen'

What is the rule of playing card "Benalish Knight"?

```sql

SELECT
  `T2`.`format`
FROM `cards` AS `T1`

WHERE
  `T1`.`name` = 'Benalish Knight'

);
CREATE TABLE `sets` (
  `id` BIGINT COMMENT 'unique id identifying this set',

  `block` TEXT COMMENT 'The block name the set was in.',
  `booster` TEXT COMMENT 'A breakdown of possibilities and weights of cards in a booster pack.',
  `code` TEXT COMMENT 'The set code for the set.',
  `isFoilOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in foil.',

  `isNonFoilOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in non-foil.',
  `isOnlineOnly` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the set is only available in online game variations.',

  `keyruneCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The matching Keyrune code for set image icons.',
  `mcmId` BIGINT COMMENT 'The Magic Card Marketset identifier.',
  `mcmIdExtras` BIGINT COMMENT 'The split Magic Card Market set identifier if a set is printed in two sets. This identifier represents the second sets identifier.',
  `mcmName` TEXT,
  `mtgoCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The set code for the set as it appears on Magic: The Gathering Online; commonsense evidence:
if the value is null or empty, then it doesnt appear on Magic: The Gathering Online',
  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The name of the set.',
  `parentCode` TEXT COMMENT 'The parent set code for set variations like promotions, guild kits, etc.',
  `releaseDate` TEXT COMMENT 'The release date in ISO 8601 format for the set.',
  `tcgplayerGroupId` BIGINT COMMENT 'The group identifier of the set on TCGplayer',
  `totalSetSize` BIGINT COMMENT 'The total number of cards in the set, including promotional and related supplemental products but excluding Alchemy modifications - however those cards are included in the set itself.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The expansion type of the set.; "alchemy", "archenemy", "arsenal", "box", "commander", "core", "draft_innovation", "duel_deck", "expansion", "from_the_vault", "funny", "masterpiece", "masters", "memorabilia", "planechase", "premium_deck", "promo", "spellbook", "starter", "token", "treasure_chest", "vanguard"'
);

【参考信息】


【用户问题】
What is the percentage of borderless cards?

```sql
output:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `borderColor` = 'borderless' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`id`)
FROM `cards`

【用户问题】
What is the percentage of cards whose language is French among the Story Spotlight cards?

```sql
output:
SELECT
  CAST(SUM(CASE WHEN `T2`.`language` = 'French' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS DOUBLE) * 100 / COUNT(`T1`.`id`)
FROM `cards` AS `T1`
INNER JOIN `foreign_data` AS `T2`
  ON `T1`.`uuid` = `T2`.`uuid`
WHERE
  `T1`.`isStorySpotlight` = 1

  `edhrecRank` BIGINT COMMENT 'The card rank on EDHRec',
  `faceConvertedManaCost` DOUBLE COMMENT 'The converted mana cost or mana value for the face for either half or part of the card.; if value is higher, it means that this card cost more converted mana for the face',

  `flavorName` TEXT COMMENT 'The promotional card name printed above the true card name on special cards that has no game function.; The promotional card name printed above the true card name on special cards that has no game function.',
  `flavorText` TEXT COMMENT 'The italicized text found below the rules text that has no game function.; The italicized text found below the rules text that has no game function.',
  `frameEffects` TEXT COMMENT 'The visual frame effects.; "colorshifted", "companion", "compasslanddfc", "devoid", "draft", "etched", "extendedart", "fullart", "inverted", "legendary", "lesson", "miracle", "mooneldrazidfc", "nyxtouched", "originpwdfc", "showcase", "snow", "sunmoondfc", "textless", "tombstone", "waxingandwaningmoondfc"',
  `frameVersion` TEXT COMMENT 'The version of the card frame style.; "1993", "1997", "2003", "2015", "future"',
  `hand` TEXT COMMENT 'The starting maximum hand size total modifier.; A + or - character precedes an integer. 
commonsense evidence:
positive maximum hand size: +1, +2, ....
negative maximum hand size: -1, ....
neural maximum hand size: 0....',

commonsense evidence:
Cards with this property may have missing or degraded properties and values.',
  `hasFoil` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card can be found in foil; 0: cannot be found 1: can be found',
  `hasNonFoil` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card can be found in non-foil; 0: cannot be found 1: can be found',
  `isAlternative` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card is an alternate variation to an original printing; 0: is not 1: is',
  `isFullArt` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card has full artwork.; 0: doesnt have, 1: has full artwork',

  `isTextless` BIGINT COMMENT 'If the card does not have a text box.; commonsense evidence:
0: has a text box;
1: doesnt have a text box;',

If the card is "timeshifted", a feature of certain sets where a card will have a different frameVersion.',

  `loyalty` TEXT COMMENT 'The starting loyalty value of the card.; Used only on cards with "Planeswalker" in its types. empty means unkown',
  `manaCost` TEXT COMMENT 'The mana cost of the card wrapped in brackets for each value.; commonsense evidence:
manaCost is unconverted mana cost',

  `number` TEXT COMMENT 'The number of the card',
  `originalReleaseDate` TEXT COMMENT 'original Release Date; The original release date in ISO 8601(opens new window) format for a promotional card printed outside of a cycle window, such as Secret Lair Drop promotions.',
  `originalText` TEXT COMMENT 'original Text; The text on the card as originally printed.',
  `originalType` TEXT COMMENT 'original Type; The type of the card as originally printed. Includes any supertypes and subtypes.',

  `power` TEXT COMMENT 'The power of the card.; commonsense evidence:
∞ means infinite power
null or * refers to unknown power',
  `printings` TEXT COMMENT 'A list of set printing codes the card was printed in, formatted in uppercase.',

commonsense evidence:
if this value is empty, then it means this card doesnt have multiple faces on the same card.',

list of all types should be the union of subtypes and supertypes',

  `name` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign name of the card.',
  `text` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign text ruling of the card.',
  `type` TEXT COMMENT 'The foreign type of the card. Includes any supertypes and subtypes.',
  `uuid` TEXT
